subject: Re: [junit] JUnit testing for MIDP applications?
msgSnippet: ... Robert The lack of reflection makes it hard for a true port. I ve Robert seen a couple of JUnit-like test tools that just didn t Robert motivate me
messageBody:
>>>>> "Robert" == Robert Sartin <sartin@...> writes:

Robert> --- Brian Button <bbutton01@...> wrote:
>> Has anyone ported junit to MIDP and J2ME yet? I'm working on an
>> application, and I'd like to avoid reinventing the wheel if
>> possible :)

Robert> The lack of reflection makes it hard for a true port. I've
Robert> seen a couple of JUnit-like test tools that just didn't
Robert> motivate me enough to use them. We use JUnit on a desktop
Robert> for our unit tests and then verify we can build with
Robert> bootclasspath set for a MIDP environment. That covers
Robert> everything except the UI.

I found the same thing that you did. We tried to run it as is, then we
tried to take bits and pieces of it as they existed, and we ran into
NoSuchClass errors everywhere :) And they mostly dealt with reflection
stuff.

The ability to write our code according to JUnit and J2SE and then
just build as you said would be great. I'm just a novice at this J2ME
MIDP stuff, but my pair partner is pretty experienced. He seems to
believe that we'll have a problem following a model like this for the
connection and socket stuff, since the API is different. Have you
encountered this?
